title: 797-C
statement: C. Minimal stringtime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputPetya recieved a gift of a stringswith length up to105characters for his birthday. He took two more empty stringstanduand decided to play a game. This game has two possible moves:Extract thefirstcharacter ofsand appendtwith this character.Extract thelastcharacter oftand appenduwith this character.Petya wants to get stringssandtempty and stringulexicographically minimal.You should write a program that will help Petya win the game.InputFirst line contains non-empty strings(1 ≤ |s| ≤ 105), consisting of lowercase English letters.OutputPrint resulting stringu.ExamplesInputcabOutputabcInputacdbOutputabdc

processed.result:
You are given a string $s$ of length at most 105. You have two empty strings, $u$ and $t$. You can play a game with these strings using the following moves:

1. Take the first character of $s$ and append it to $t$.
2. Take the last character of $t$ and append it to $u$.

The goal is to make strings $u$ and $t$ empty while keeping $u$ lexicographically smaller than $t$.  Output the resulting string $u$.

You are given a string. You can play a game by taking the first or last character of the string and adding it to another empty string.  What is the lexicographically smallest string you can create by playing this game?
